Uses of Interface
javaslang.control.Validation

  • Packages that use Validation 
    Package Description
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.

    • Uses of Validation in javaslang.control

      default <E2,T2> Validation<E2,T2> Validation.bimap(Function<? super E,? extends E2> errorMapper, Function<? super T,? extends T2> valueMapper)
      Whereas map only performs a mapping on a valid Validation, and leftMap performs a mapping on an invalid Validation, bimap allows you to provide mapping actions for both, and will give you the result based on what type of Validation this is.
      default <U> Validation<E,U> Validation.flatMap(Function<? super T,? extends Validation<E,? extends U>> mapper) 
      static <E,T> Validation<E,T> Validation.from(Either<E,T> either)
      Creates a Validation of an Either.
      static <E,T> Validation<E,T> Validation.invalid(E error)
      Creates an Validation.Invalid that contains the given error.
      default <U> Validation<U,T> Validation.leftMap(Function<? super E,? extends U> f)
      Applies a function f to the error of this Validation if this is an Invalid.
      default <U> Validation<E,U> Validation.map(Function<? super T,? extends U> f) 
      default Validation<E,T> Validation.peek(Consumer<? super T> action) 
      default Validation<T,E> Validation.swap()
      Flip the valid/invalid values for this Validation.
      static <E,T> Validation<E,T> Validation.valid(T value)
      Creates a Validation.Valid that contains the given value.

      default <U> Validation.Builder<E,T,U> Validation.combine(Validation<E,U> validation)
      Combines two Validations to form a Validation.Builder, which can then be used to perform further combines, or apply a function to it in order to transform the Validation.Builder into a Validation.
